Great museum!. I already had been in Malba Museum a few years ago, and I had the opportunity to come back there last week, and it´s been a pleasure to see new and modern paintings, sculptures and instalations while you walk inside this beautiful museum. Worth a while for those who love art!
weird and small. Being from New York… this was kind of a joke. Only 2 floors and one floor was dedicated to an artist who does light displays (weird part)…. not very impressive.

very good museum. When you visit la Recoleta, you can walk a take a taxi to Palermo , you can visit and you can not miss it, is the Museo de Arte Latinoamericano de Buenos Aires, MALBA , at avenida Figueroa Alcorta....I strongly recomend, art from the xx century Le Parc, Lumiere, etc.
FABULOUS. What to do on a Sunday afternoon?? We spent a wonderful afternoon here experiencing marvelous modern art. We also had a lovely lunch in the cafe. Highly recommend to all.
Very intersting. Great place to go and Visit of You aré in Buenos Aires , Argentina. The permanent colection is great and ther's always something interesting to see.

A Unique Glimpse into Argentina's Modern Art World. Located quite near Recoleta, this is a quick exposure to the fine art of B.A. We wandered through this museum pleased by much of the unique paintings and sculpture. I prefer more traditional art, however, this museum was far from boring....

A very worthwhile afternoon. While not boasting famous classics, the Malba features very interesting temporary and permanent collections. The building is modern and airy, more like Moma than the Met. A very enjoyable couple of hours. It is also located on one of Buenos Aires' famous boulevards that are worth the trip unto themselves.
A must if in Buenos Aires. A wonderful collection of Latin American Art well displayed and easy to appreciate. The city has few museums this is a charm.

You can't miss it!. If you like Latinamerican modern art this is the place to visit! From Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, Antonio Berni to Alejandro Xul Solar and other great modern painters, photographers and sculptures. Their exhibitions are also worth seeing. They also have a cinema and a great Cafe.

MALBA. I am a Sustaining Member of the MALBA, and have been for many years, Excellent museum of Latin American Art. The restaurant is run by Marcelo (Piegari) who has a restaurant in Puerto Madero. The food is excellent, but prices much too high in relation to the place, in my opinion. Worth a visit
a must in Buenos Aires. New and Modern building. Well located. Most of the time excellent Latin American paintings. A Museum to visit. On Wednesday free

Such a great place. I thoroughly enjoyed a couple of hours here. Fun and interesting modern art - great building with lots of light. An added bonus was a very good restaurant. You could have a coffee or a full blown meal. We had a main course and a coffee and the food was excellent.There was a good mix of traditional modern paintings as well as more contemporary sculpture and installations. Good for children too.

Basic. I expected more from the place, but it's just one floor of the permanent exhibition with a couple of dozen works, and not the most outstanding ones in the comparison with the rest of the world's modern art. We did happen to visit during the Le Parc Lumier exhibition so that was well worth it. If you have plenty of time and don't know what to do go and see it, but otherwise you can easily skip it.

One of the most enjoyable art museums I have been to in the world!. Was not expecting to be blown away (though reviews were overwhelmingly positive), but my boyfriend (who is not as interested in art as I am) and I both enjoyed MALBA immensely. The museum has a very good and varied mix of art, with modern, contemporary, and more traditional art presented in different small exhibits. MALBA is definitely good for those with shorter attention spans, as the exhibits give a very clear sense of their theme with a condensed number of works. We were also there during the "light exhibit" (by an artist named LeMarc) which was a genuinely cool installation using things like mirrors and CDs to throw light in interesting ways.A tip for travelling students: if you get and bring an ISIC card (highly recommended, at least within Latin America given the number of things you get for half-off or free), you get in for free.

Amazing museum! Best visit in Buenos Aires! Light exhibit was awe-inspiring.. We went because we saw a great recommendation on TripAdviser and wanted to see the much talked about light exhibit inside. The cost to go in was very reasonable. The building was modern and light. The entrance area was an instant wow factor with a superb yellow mobile hanging. Each room was filled with interesting art works. The light displays were fantastic! I stood for ages transfixed by the moving works. Along the corridors are wooden benches with carved slats that then twist and twirl around the walls and over the edges. Wood craft at its best! Do not miss this place if you like modern art. This is way better than the Arte du Moderno.

More Argentine than Latin American, but still great small modern art museum. I am not a huge modern art fan but really enjoyed our visit here. I agree that since at least 75% of the artwork is by Argentine artists, the "Latin American" art title of the museum is a little misleading. However, the museum is relatively new. It opened in 2001 so hopefully it is working on expanding its Latin American collection because I think that would add to the experience. That aside, there was plenty to enjoy about the museum. First, I loved the Le Parc exhibit of light sculptures. It was something I had never seen before. Second, the permanent collection is not too big but interesting. Also, the building's design is pretty impressive with the cool benches, atrium and modern art sculptures. Most if not all the descriptions have English translations and the admission price of 50 pesos is pretty reasonable. Even though the building is big, there is not that an overwhelming amount to see. We were there around 90 minutes and saw everything. Overall, it was an interesting experience and if you enjoy this museum, I would also recommend checking out the Coleccion de Arte Amalia Lacroze de Fortabat in Puerto Madero

Great Latin American art collection.. The thing I like about MALBA is that the collection of Latin American modern art is great and not only Argentinian, you can find Botero's work (Colombia), Frida Kahlo (Mexico) and even other international pieces and temporary exhibitions such as Mario Testino Photography. Great museum, also the building itself is a nice piece of architecture and a lot of things to do in the surroundings.

Not to be missed. I have been here several times and have enjoyed my visits thoroughly. The building alone is worth a visit, with its modern glass walls, atrium, and city views. Modern art is the main focus, but retrospectives cover a larger time-frame of works. There was a historic mural on display this month from the provinces, along with a botanical eco-themed exhibit. Each visit will be unique but fascinating.

Very enjoyable morning.. Very well presented museum currently featuring retro modern art from the 70's and 80's. Some of the featured exhibits were variations on mechanical light manipulations that were very interesting.

Le Parc exhibit a must. Terrific, contained gallery of Sth American artists but what stood out for me was the current exhibition by light artist Julio Le Parc. Get along if you're in BA at the moment.
Good way to kill a few hours!. This is well worth a visit. It has a lot of varieties of modern art, including (when I went) extensive light displays which I found impressive and original.
I didnt understand anything. It is very pretensious. And, besides Frida, all the artists were argentinians. There is no sense in calling it Latin American

Very interesting light exhibit and upscale dining. The meal was the best pasta I had accompanied by a bottle of Malbec and shared dessert.
The light display took two large spaces, was occasionally interactive. Glad we went.

Very interesting..... Several exhibits make it well worth the visit..... The lighting exhibit was featured (LeParc) and the museum also had other permanent displays. Also interesting is a walk around the museum neighborhood, one of the ritzy areas of Buenos Aires, with some very nice homes and residences.

Lovely museum. Their front desk crew is very kind. But the art security personell are very unkind and rough at times. A very good collection and while we were there there was this south american art exposition which I enjoyed the most. A very pleasant building, with an overall impressive arts and architectural ensemble. Located in a very beautiful neighborhood. Worth the visit. Oh, and their shop displays some very nice crafted products for a very good price. Loved it.
Bright Colorful Fresh Air But Small. A delightful museum, showcasing Latin American contemporary art. It was over much too soon which is to say its not a huge museum.

Le parc lumiere. Their own collection gives a good impression of the development of modern art in south americe. Definitely nice pieces! But then right now they have an exposition of le parc, amazing stuff if you like moving art that doesnt have one perspective!!

Light Installations. As I believe art is subjective I would just prefer to just stick to saying I enjoyed going to MALBA, I was even happier when I found out it was half price Wednesdays ($25) and I personally enjoyed the light installations the most.
Malba was ok. Malba was a little small and it was nice but some of the staff were a little snotty, especially the female in the shop... : /
Excellent!!. Highlight to the brazilian modernist paint Abaporu and the Frida Kahlo's self-portrait. Nice building and facilities as well.
Nice place to go. The Malba has interesting expositions and a permanent collection with great works of Latin American artists.
Brilliant exhibition!. Great museum with interesting permanent pieces. When I went they had Le Park Luminere exhibition which was incredible!

Interactive Exhibit. As one of our daughters is an art history major in college we wanted to check out the local modern art museum, the Malba. It's quite small, but had many great pieces from artists we hadn't previously heard of. The currently temporary exhibit was by a light artist that everyone loved because of how interactive and playful it was. Budget around 1 hour for the museum.
A must in Buenos Aires. MALBA's collection has works from many great latin american artists, from different eras and conceptions. You can enter for free if you're a student.

A beautiful space for some beautiful art. I love museums, but my attention wanes after about 90 minutes. Everything starts blending together and I have a hard time remembering what I saw that I loved. The MALBA is perfect in that regard given its relatively small size. Add to that the beautiful, airy architecture, the modern design of which was a perfect backdrop for the art housed there, and an introduction to many Latin American artists who aren't as widely seen or recognized in the US - and it was a perfect afternoon. We also grabbed lunch at the café, which was probably overpriced, but served fresh, interesting, and tasty lunches.

A "Palermo Staple". The museum is just the right size for a nice stroll. The pieces of work are more than likely to make you pause and wonder. The facility has a simple layout and is accessible for any specific need. The museum has friendly staff, and due to its location, you can have the museum as part of your Palermo area visit.
Nice place to visit. Beautiful and famous paintings, includind the "Abaporu" by Tarsila do Amaral and "Frida Kahlo". There are others too, but these two are worth a visist.

Great temporary exhibit. My husband and I visited MALBA in July 2014. We LOVED the Le Parc Lumière temporary exhibit. The museum is small in comparison to other art museums, but was very nice. Expect to spend about 2 hours there.
Beautiful, trendy. Mario Testino fashion photo exposition and all the meseum itself. Always has some good and nice artist exposing there.
This museum will make you sleepy after visit. Nothing is special that you should pay to visit. Three of us went there and find it's very boring. And needed to drink a coffee to keep us awake.

Interesting Museum. MALBA has an amazing permanent exhibition with the most important artists from Latin-America. The dark rooms have incredible sculptures that you can interact with and even the kids never get bored. It is necessary some time to see it all because it is a bit crowded, but once you are there most of the things are charming, specially the sculpted benches.

Wonderful museum. I went there with My two daughters
One is 7 and the other is 9.
They loved the place. Very organized and complete.
Dont miss the chocolate mouse at the coffee shop

Must see while in BA. The MALBA has a wonderful permanent collection. The museum itself is beautiful and the galleries are arranged well. We visited during Le Marc's "Lumiére" exposition. If you happened to be in town while it is here, don't miss it.
Overall, the museum's collection spans Latin America, with extremely diverse works of art, mostly from the 20th century.
MALBA. Extraordinary building, wonderful exhibitions and great restaurant and shop! Tracey Emin and Latin American art History were great!

Best museum I've ever been to. This museum is probably not for the hardcore art fans since the collection is pretty small. You can do the whole museum in 1,5 hours which is kinda nice, because then you have time to focus on every painting a bit longer without feeling the need to rush through because of the size. They have some pretty good pieces by Kahlo, Botero etc. I loved this place!
Fabulous building!. Interesting modern art, but the building's design was more noteworthy. Very good museum shop too. Definitely worth a visit.

Excellent exhibit, a bit small. I came about three days too early for the main exhibit on the top floor so I only had access to the permanent collection and the collection on the ground floor. Nevertheless, I thought the permanent collection was quite excellent and entertaining, albeit a bit small (you can finish it within an hour. ) There were interactive, electric-powered art installations that really intrigued me and the area truly did give me a better sense of Latin American art. I didn't care too much for what was going on on the ground floor. I believe it was more local, contemporary based artists. I can't complain too much though; at only $50 pesos as of July 2014 it's not a steep price to pay for a small but excellent collection.
Beautiful museum. With a nice restaurant, the building is modern and has of the best of South Américan artists. For art lovers. Art Works from Frida, Hélio Oiticica, Tarsila and many more.
you have to visit. invaluable private collection. The building is a beatiful thing itself and the shop have nice things as well

Lovely Little Museum. My family and I very much enjoyed this museum. A nice mix of Latin American paintings and sculptures. We especially enjoyed the current exhibit using light for art. Very interesting and only there for about a month, so don't miss it! A great museum for kids as the art is modern and visually interesting for young eyes (almost "cartoony") and it isn't terribly large, so the little ones won't get bored! Free coat check, bargain price for entrance and overall, a great way to send 1-1 1/2 hrs on a rainy day. Definitely recommend to get a taste of porteno/LA culture!

Some great pieces, not as extensive as I'd thought. MALBA is in a really well-designed building and the pieces are well set out and ordered. Really great to see promotion of excellent modern art of Latin America.The collection didn't seem extensive and I think it could have benefited from a seasonal /temporary exhibit (in fact, I think at other times there is, we just missed it).Well worth a visit.
Lovely Musuem. Great collection and fairly small. Went here on a wet day and was well worth the visit. Museum is well set out and houses some really interesting pieces.

Ehh.... Maybe we've been spoiled by the MoMA in New York and other amazing museums worldwide, but this museum was disappointing. There is one painting by Diego Rivera and one by Frida Kahlo, but the rest of the collection was not worth it in our opinions. We cruised through it pretty quickly. The building itself is an incredible space and very beautiful. But half of it was closed for either renovation or a new installment. Either way, we didn't think we got our $50 pesos each out of it. The best thing is that there are good explanations in English that help you along.

baby MOMA in Buenos Aires. Their permanent collection includes good Latin American arts. Has a nice restaurant, theater and a cute gift shop. Sometimes collections travel to MALBA from other cities around the world.
Don't miss it. the Museo de Arte Latinoamericano de Buenos Aires is interesting place to visit in a nice area of the City. A great opportunity to learn more about the Latin american culture.

Superb. We visited the museum and with seamless entry it was cool . The highlight was the relocation of a painting and the video which shows how it has been done . The only minus point is that they do not have a recorded player to tell us about the details of painting , overall a good experience

Modern art museum. In addition to Tarcila and Frida ´s paitings, there are other modernist paintings, sculptures and photographs by other latin american artists.It is worth the visit and you´re allowed to take pictures, if you like.

Excelent. Excelent selection of south american artist. Botero, Berni, Di Cavalcanti, Tarcila Amaral, everybody is there.Beside it is not a huge collection you can have a nice panorama of the south america art.Don't miss their cafe down stairs.

an open museum. I went here mainly (or almost solely) to see paint of Frida Kahlo, one of their permanent collections. here, photograph is permitted without flash. Good balance of both classic and modern pieces.Since this museum is on a one way avenue, you may be advised to walk to get there, depending on where you catch a cab. at least that's how I ended up. (about 20 to 30 minutes of walk from Evita Museum)

So worth it!. This museum holds a very nice collection of paintings of artists from South America and deserves a visit if you can. It is open till 8pm so if you have a couple of hours before going to dinner I would recommend you pay them a visit. There's no guided visit so it's worth to get acquainted with some of the paitings history and the artists that painted them so you can put everything into context and appreciate it. Also the building is really nice, new and purpose built, it has a nice posh cafe and a very art nice shop. Great visit!

Wish more was poem. Paid full regular price - it was between exhibitions - but only on full was open ( and not even 100%). The entire 2nd floor was closed. Nice what was shown but they should not charge full price when entire floors are closed. Plus it is not that easy to get to with public transportation
Great!. I enjoyed my experience at this museum. Entrance fee is relatively cheap and the permanent collection is great.

Wonderful Museum! Great Artwork. This museum was truly beautiful everything from the architecture to the level of though put into the displays. The Mario Testino exhibit changed how I view fashion photography.

Beautiful. Saw the Mario Testino exhibit. Was amazing. Many iconic pics.
When you buy your ticket, if you have a Samsung Smart phone, the price it's 2 for 1. Well worth it

Much publicity. This museum enjoys lots of publicity and it is considered very "in" to go to its exhibitions. Even being good, I would rather recommend foreign visitors to go to the Modern Arts and Contemporary Arts Museums located, one beside the other at Avenida San Juan 350. It is not so "in" but the collection is good and the temporary exhibitions are excellent. It is near San Telmo and Plaza Dorrego, another tourist attraction. This museums charge a minimal fee while at the MALBA you have to pay a substantial amount.
Top museum in Buenos Aires. The Mario Testino photo exhibit was phenomenal, but the permanent collection is by itself worth the visit!
small but great. I thought the place was bigger, but the quality of the art was great. Good that it stays open till late.

Plan time to fully enjoy. I thoroughly enjoyed the various exhibits. The entry staff is pleasant, but if people monitoring the exhibits are not. I got a tap on the shoulder from a guard as my foot had encroached 3" over a line. (sigh.) Nice gift shop with some unique finds.

Probably the best contemporary art museum in South America. Like: Building design, permanent collection of Latin American contemporary art, temporary exhibits, café, museum shop, location.Dislike: Unfriendly staff.

Remarkable. One of the best contemporary art museum we have visited in the world. Very airy, great architecture, interesting exhibits benefiting from clever setting. Pleasant and good food for thoughts.
Modern museum with changing expositions. Went there when there was an exhibition of a famous fashion photogropher which was very nice. Go there on Wednesday to get a discounted entry.
A world class museum. A very good approach to Latinamerican art. THe endeavour of the most important Argentinean art patrons.

Cute place, great cafe. Cute and manageable museum. Curated very well. The testino exhibition was surprisingly very interesting.
Very interesting gift shop

Great building and collection. We spent several hours here. Loved the bench that spread over the rail into the atrium, the disappearing photos, the collection of known-to-me and new-to-me collection. Wished we could have crossed the way and visited the Japanese Garden but it was pouring.
Excellent. A good museum with wonderfully curated exhibitions. The temporary exhibition I got to see was awesome.

Variety of art media in a great building. We visited this museum on May because of an exhibit of Pictures by the photographer Mario Testino. That exhibit was great! There are at least 4 other exhibits of different kind of media, sculptures, paintings etc. It is worth the visit as you might find something that appeals to your taste.

MUSEO DE ARTE LATINOAMERICANO DE BUENOS AIRES. This museum includes many interesting paintings, photos and sculptures by Latin-American artists of the 20th Century to these days. The exhibits are cleverly displayed in a building where natural light plays an important role. The building and its permanent contents belong to an Argentine collector's foundation , but there are periodic exhibitions of works by famous artists from all parts of the world. For example, at this time of writing,until June 16th, there is an exhibition of Mario Testino's photographs, and last year Yayoi Kusama's works attracted thousands of visitors from neighbouring countries and abroad. The museum opens at 12pm every day except tuesdays.

Generous space. Attractive contempory building with an exhibit of photographs by Mario Testino we loved seeing. The cafe is an excellent place for lunch and all 4 of us enjoyed our meals. The museum gift shop has a great bookshop and good quality gifts that includes some local craft items. This was my 4th or 5th visit in about as many years and I have never been disappointed.

Excellent Museum. MALBA is a great contemporary art museum. They had some wonderful exhibitions going on when we were there. The space is great as well. If you like contemporary style art this is a great place for it.

Modern Beauty. MALBA is a small, but excellent gem of a museum, located in an upscale neighborhood of Buenos Aires. The building is ultra modern befitting the art contained within (think I.M. Pei modern). The permanent collection starts in the early 20th century and continues to the present. The MALBA also has special exhibitions. Entry fees are modest. There is café and gift shop. We spent 1-2 hours and enjoyed our experience.
Small, good space. It is small, well designed, it had a great exhibition by Mario Testino when were there, worth checking it out

MLABA. There was a great photographic display on while we were visiting. But the works regularly on display were exceptional. Paintings by Diego Riviera, Frida Kahlo and a superb Remedios Varo painted votive art piece were just some of the wonders on display. Go!
Amazing!!. if you love art.. you are going to love the malba museum.. is located in palermo area and the green areas over there are awesome !!! clean and majestic!!! you must!

One of the best museums in BA. It is definitely one of the best museums in BA. The permanent collection includes some pieces from Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera. If you enjoy modern art, this is definitely the must in BA.

Representative Selection of Latin Artists. We returned to MALBA and viewed the exhibition of 20th Century Argentine art displayed there. It was a very broad and varied collection of paintings and sculptures by South American artists ranging from Mexico and the Caribbean to Argentina. Many names we recognized: Freida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, Fernando Botero and Antonio Berni, and many more were new to us. The building was modern and is a cultural centre presenting films and lectures in addition to art exhibitions. The temporary exhibit on display consisted of larger-than-life size glamour photography of international celebrities such as Brad Pitt and David Beckham and models Naomi Campbell and Kate Moss among many others. (The battery in my camera died after the zoo and South American art exhibition so I have no celebrity photos to offer.)

Incredible exhibit of photos by Mario Testino. This exhibit was a 5. The rest of the museum is good, but certainly not exceptional. A great Frida Kahlo and Diego, and some interesting pieces. But, not one of the great museums in the world.

Nice, small modern art museum.. A well done, manageably sized museum of modern art. If museums interest you at all, MALBA is worth a stop while in Buenos Aires. You can enjoy it in a couple of hours and it's well-organized in a beautiful building. The temporary Mario Testino exhibition was great.

A simple, nice, relaxing, and entertaining place to go often.. Like the central park of Buenos Aires, it naturally is without the hills and rocks, but has a vast area coverage. Splaying grass openness with trees, that have fairs integrated into it, with botanical parks, a planetarium (where a huge pillow fight is annually held), concerts, etc. Be careful after hours because the more poor locals tend to seek out tourists, especially in places you won't have safety- like here, so don't take your date out here and stick around for when it gets dark because the whole onda (vibe) changes to a darker more dangerous one. If you are living in BA, you will find that a nice thing to do is make a simple life that you can share with others. For example, go get your mate, a book, a guitar, friends, some food, and spend time in the park- that's where the fun is, I cannot even recall how many friends I've met doing that. It's really a place to meet people. Very social. Go in the summer when they have all the great and free events, while the roses of the rose garden are blooming, and the fairs are bustling.

Beautiful building, unique art. A very modern attractive facility housing Latin American art. What we saw was the modern/contemporary floor. Wish the dining room had been open as it's lovely and is said to be very good. We were fortunate to be there for a book signing. Cool gift shop.
Excellent!. If you want to get an idea of modern art in Argentina, don't miss it in any way...Maybe their artists are not so known in Europe, but you get the feeling, the history of the country..
Wonderful!. Go! It's at the top of my list for BA. Great museum, very affordable, and full of beautiful art. And hey, free wifi!

Don't Miss This. We don't usually do art museums that are narrow in collection. But visiting with a guide at another museum in the area, she suggested visiting this one. We absolutely loved it. The exhibits were delightful, charming in some cases. The building itself was amazing.

Great for learning about modern Latin American art. This museum was very interesting for me as I was only familiar with Mexican artists (the muralists, Frida Kahlo). I was able to learn a lot more about other Latin American artists, some of whom I had heard of and others who were completely new to me. I really enjoyed it and left with the names of some new artists to learn about.I unfortunately had only an hour, but this was enough time for me to appreciate the permanent collection. I did not get to see the temporary exhibits, but they did look interesting. I would recommend going with more time if you can.Also, the museum cafe is very nice! I enjoyed a coffee there while waiting for the museum to open.
Must see for art lovers. What a wonderful place to be not only in terms of the modern architecture but also of the exhibits covering modern southamerican artist including Frida Kahlo!

Don't skip Malba!. Beautifully curated museum with lots to see. Saw the Mario Testino exhibit, which was glossy and gorgeous. The movies they screen sound great, but didn't align with our schedule...The cafe downstairs is great to enjoy a drink on the patio & people watch.

Honeymoon and 1st Anniversary. The Museum was more than we expected with quite a few surprises including a pictorial exhibit by Mario Testa and an original by Frida Kahlo! The architecture of the museum was also very impressive.

Small, pricey but interesting. A modern building with some good pieces. There is a small range of modern art from s. America and gives you a good insight into the artists in this area of the world. Could be bigger, top floor closed.
Beautiful building and great collection. I love the building and the location...The permanent collection and the current exhibit was great. I highly recommend it.
Interesting. Nice. But is not excellent. Since is near from other atraction it should be visited if you are in the neighborhood.

MALBA lives up to the hype. Excellent collection in an art-soaked building. Loved the contemporary Latin art collection - oh so colorful, and a lovely introduction to the development of the Latin Art ethos.
A great modern art museum. From the high quality artists expositions to the modern building, the shop & the restaurant , the MALBA is highly recommended!

Good Museum. Good Restaurant.. Nice museum with a good selection of Latin American art. The restaurant is very good and well worth the price.
At the time of the visit an retrospective of Mario Testino's work was on - which meant plenty of boob photography to be seen!

Fantastic museum..... This is one of the better museums that I have been to.... The setting is pretty amazing, ultra modern, light and airy and a picture of calm in a bustling city. We were fortunate enough to go when the Mario Testino exhibition was on which was a real highlight for us.... So many familiar images which you have seen in magazines but not realised it was by Mario... Pictures of Kate, Nadia, Naomi, Gisele, madonna.... Loved the pictures of Kate moss in particular and also the one of P Diddy and Naomi having fun.Other highlights included the permanent exhibitions of the South/ Latin American artists like Frieda Kahlo and other notables...The space was also great for kids because it allowed them to roam around pretty freely!
Modern Art. Always in vogue. Always with something new on going. Always with updated news about arts and artists visiting from all over the world. Worths the visit

The best museum on BA. It is well designed, continuously offering new exhibits, from the most classical to the most daring. Restrooms, cafe and shop are just fine. Try the outside tables to sunbathe a little bit.

Very nice. Not a too large museum (which is a great plus from my point of view), It is very nice to see Latin American art - the exhibitions (both the temporary and constant ones) are very interesting - and the museum itself is in a modern building (not a fast-dusty old site), It is located next to the Palermo gardens and the whole area is worth visiting.

A Latin American Fashion Photographer. Mario Tostino has photographed Madonna, Lady Diana, Mick Jagger, Jennifer Lopez and many more celebrities throughout his 30 plus year career as a fashion photographer. The current restrospective exhibit of his work is one of a kind. At first I felt that I was looking at a Vogue magazine, the usual classy photos, but since this is a retrospective that includes color and black photography, it did not take me long to transcend the familiar and begin to understand the enourmous talent of Mario Testino. The size of the prints is huge, the imagination that permeates the sets and colors is impressive. The imagery invites a desire to access the additional shots that must have on the rolls where the ones selected for this show must have come from.I highly recommend this exhibit.

Testino and more. Well, we had to queue, but it was worth it. I go to this museum every time I visit Buenos Aires. They have a standing collection of modern art and a visiting collection. This time it was the glamorous photos of Mario Testino. Well worth the (short) wait. The timed entry was so that you could get a good look at the pictures, close up and from a distance. They've added some new things to the permanent collection and it was good to see old favourites. With entry for 50 pesos, it is good value for money.

Small but impressive. The museum has a small but impressive collection of modern / contemporary art that is well curated. Pieces include work by Botero, Frida Kalho etc. The building itself is a pleasure to look at; light filled and airy with clean lines. Fortunately for me, there was also a Mario Testino exhibition on of his fashion photographs over the years. While this exhibition was more on the commercial side, it does serve to highlight a good range of his work.

Nice place to spend a few hours. Excellent small museum, in a great location. We spent about 2 pleasant hours after a nice lunch in the neighborhood crusing around this museum. The permanent exhibit is interesting and provides a nice perspective to latin american art. There was also a very interesting temporary exhibit.

Must See Museum. Mario Testino exhibit was very sexy and interesting. This is a must see. There is also a very nice restaurant located in the museum. We didn't have time to stop for a drink on their outdoor patio, but it looked really quaint and relaxing.

Great collection of latin american art. the malba is one of the best latin american art collections in the world. It was on our bucket list from the second we landed in the city and we were not let down by our visit. Great space with lots of good pieces anda superb visiting exposition
Malba. Malba is a very nice musuem to visit and they had an excellent photo exhibit going on. The uenos Aires museum prices are so much cheaper than the United States

Mario Testino Exhibit is a must. The Mario Testino exhibit was stunning. I would not miss it.
We then had a lovely lunch at the museum cafe which is frequented mostly by locals (at least during the week). It was great for people watching. It is a more upscale and expensive restaurant but worth it.

Excellent museum. Great permanent collection, fantastic current exhibition, Mario Testino "In your Face", good but pricey restaurant and nice gift shop. Malba is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon in BsAs.

Worth a visit. The museum is small and can be viewed in its entirety in less then 2 hours. Has an interesting mix of art and had a fabulous exhibit of photos from Vogue magazines. One of the few museums open on Monday.

Loved it!. They have a really great collection of Latin American art, old and modern. My pet peeve however is the lighting. They light the paintings with direct light on them so you cannot stand back in front of the painting. In order to see it, you need to view from the side.

Museum under renovation. We could only the basement hall of the museum because the upper floor was said to be under renovation. Entrance is however free of charge to everybody, so you should visit the museum at least to see the beautiful paintings and sculptures in the basement floor.

Nice small museum. The museum is not very large but the collection of Latin American artists is impressive: Frida Khalo, Diego Rivera, Di Cavalcanti, Tarsila do Amaral, Portinari, Botero among others. Anyone who is interested in Latin American art should visit MALBA when in BsAs.

Be careful. The malba museum (latino americano museum) its a place that you can t miss, but be very careful with the locker room where you must leave your lagage, on 27mar around 13h, the pesos that I Had in my backpack loft there vanished!!

Great museum. Really great building with some really impressive pieces. My favorite is the bench that is on the second floor where planks of wood curve and intertwine on the floor and climb up the walls of the entire building.
Present exhibit. What a sensational temporary exhibit they have of the photographic work of Mario Testino!! Well worth the visit!! And a grand place for lunch!!

Great stop for Art Lovers. The MALBA museum (as it’s known in Buenos Aires) is a great museum for art enthusiast of all sorts. The Collection is not huge, so plan for a two hour visit, but it has a broad selection of artists from multiple periods. On the higher floor, the museum offers temporary exhibitions…. When we were there, they were showing the Photographs of Mario Testoni, all brilliantly displayed in a carefully curated selection. I was inspired!The museum also has a very good Italian restaurant (in case you want to linger a bit longer) and a great shop for souvenirs, etc)Don’t miss it!

Amazing and interesting pieces!. Absolutely loved it. I'm not a museum or an art gallery type of person - I'm more of an outdoorsy type and I get bored easily but this was great! Amazing pieces and so much variety.
I think I like the cafe better. Nice collection of modern art; not too overwhelming. The café is popular with the locals -- great lunch.
Wonderful museum.... Great location, architecture, reasonable prices, good personnel, a complete joy...must see by all means

Must check out the Mario Testino exhibit!. The museum is small, but set in a beautifully bright building with lots of natural light.We went to see the Mario Testino exhibit which is there until the middle of June - worth the price of admission alone! Five rooms filled with large format shots taken by this fabulous photographer.The museum shop is cute and book store (downstairs) is really great.A nice afternoon out - no need for more than 2 hours.

Small, but fascinating. MALBA has a great collection focusing primarily on the 20th century and early 21st. Works include most of the Latin American artists you would have heard of, and many that you'll want to investigate further. The top floor was closed when we were there, so we didn't spend as much time as we had allotted, but the art we saw was great. I'll give a special shout-out to the fabulous bench/art on the first floor (above the entrance)--it turned the entire building into a work of art.

Selected pieces of art to remind us of Latin America. This museums has a lot of master pieces from master artists from Latin America. It is a well deserved tour and opportunity to breath a lot of art and history. Brazilians will be sentimental looking at the most famous Tarsila do Amaral painting. While Mexicans may feel proud of some Diego Rivera and Frida's pieces.I reccomend going there. It opens around lunch time, so be there at one of the first things on your list and then you can walk to other places. In one hour time, you will manage to see everything there is inside!Be aware that some discount may be applicable to people that have Samsung devices. You pay one ticket and get the other for free.
If you like art, this is a must. Exciting art, brilliantly exhibited. Don't miss it while in Buenos Aires! The museum restaurant is good for lunch.
Wide assortment of pieces - limited number. We really enjoyed the range of different works on display - but were a bit disappointed at the small number of actual pieces. Very contemporary.

A Nice Stop for A Short Visit. I really enjoyed my visit to the MALBA. There is a nice SMALL collection of modern Latin American art. The top story of the museum was closed as they were setting up a new exhibit to open in March, so seeing the remaining collection took just over an hour. There were some wonderful pieces, and I was surprised to see a lovely Frida Kahlo self-portrait. While I enjoyed what I saw, I would have given this museum 5 stars IF the top floor was open or if the collection was larger. I didn't eat in the museum cafe, but it looked like a great setting for a pre-viewing drink or lunch.

Beautiful Building, Interesting Art, Excellent Cafe. The art is interesting, but not especially arresting as artists are mostly unknown to Americans. Probably our loss. The cafe is an excellent choice for lunch. The museum is small and the entry fee modest.
Top-notch exhibition of latin-american contemporary art. very beautiful building, the collections are extremely well displayed. The visit will take a little more than one hour.
The 8th Art. The museum building itself, the wonderful collection that often makes you smile then lunch outdoors under the trees enjoying great food and wine. Unmissable
Fabulous.. Wonderful contemporary art museum, very well curated with diverse and intriguing exhibits. Don't miss it.

Great art...average food.. Love the Malba and on previous visits, always enjoyed the light lunches offered in the restaurant. On this visit, we were disappointed... I believe the operation has changed hands since our last visit. Our rather expensive (by Argentina standards) seafood salad was brimming with tough bits of octopus and little else. With two beers, desserts and coffee, the price tag was far too high. Oh and don't sit outside unless you enjoy eating in a cloud of smoke. Stick to the cool, air conditioned dining room and maybe stick to coffee and postres.
visit to the gallerypaintings. Fantastic modern building with beautiful Argentinian contemporary paintings which we never see in UK

Skip the exhibits and head for the restaurant. The guide books and some of our friends recommended that we see this.Maybe it was just a weak month, but the exhibits were average. The bookstore was disappointing as well.However, we would highly recommend the restaurant.

Wow!. Want to be dazzled by exciting, innovative and brilliant modern and contemporary Latin American art? This is a must-do stop while you are in Buenos Aires. The works are laid out beautifully in a fantastic modern building. The gift shop is a bit weak, but the café is wonderful.
South American Artists. Not very large, but wonderful collection of South American artists. Definitely worth a trip to see when in Buenos Aires

Love that's it's small: can see everything!. I love art museums: but the problem I usually experience is that they're too big to see everything in an hour or so. I find myself rushing through them when traveling and know that I might not be back. Malba is a nice size for those that want a great overview of modern art, but being overly saturated or rushed through the experience.They sponsor some great traveling exhibits. Check the popularity beforehand: some special exhibits attract crowds willing to wait several hours in line to see them. There is a student discount, if you have your ID card.

Some great pieces. I had low expectations but was pleasantly surprised. The building is funky and the art was really good. Glad I went on Wednesday when it was cheaper, not sure I would have paid full price.

Not too spectacular. We love visiting modern architecture and are prepared to walk many miles to see one, especially musea. The MALBA is highly priced but as a building it is not spectacular. Yes it has clean lines and is an example of deconstructivisme but it din't surprise or awe us.The permanent collection is nice for a quick visit. The exhibit of Liliana Porter was the only thing that surprised us in a good sense.
Interesting. Very interesting and renowned as "cooooool" but I would rather visit the Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes in Recoleta and the Modern Art Museums in San Telmo.
Worth a visit. Nice, modern building with an interesting collection of Latin American artists. We enjoyed it and would recommend a visit. Also it's the only museum open on Mondays
Fantastic experience well worth it. We enjoyed this experience . We originally weren't going to thus museum but persuaded yo do so at the last minute. Well wort h it.

Great outing, even with kids. Shockingly my very young children had a blast here. It's a beautiful space with a manageable collection that is accessible because of the different forms (lots of sculpture, a great installation piece that was like the best model art you could imagine), the bold shapes and colors, and the sense of fun in a lot of it

An OK show, nothing exciting to see. It was an air-conditioned break from the hot humid temperature of BA that day. It was not what we expected and a small display area of OK art. Besides that it was not really worth the time to go and see it.

A Big Yawn. This museum did not inspire, a big yawn actually. You can go around the corner to the excellent Fine Arts Museum and it's free! Then go to the gorgeous Decorative Arts Museum and have lunch at Croque Madame.

If you REALLY like modern art.... We decided to check out this museum because it was recommended in our travel guide, which said that the main theme was latin-american art. It failed to mention that it's only modern art, something we don't exactly like.Furthermore, the second floor is closed until march 15.Overall very disappointing.

Forget it. Not worth a visit. Very small and pretty poor modern art, a bit of pop art and that's it. They currently charge the full price although one third of the exhibition is closed due to preparation.

Truly enjoyed the art. The museum was a great one to visit. The works it houses are excellent . This had wonderfully creative art ( not really weird art), some beautifully classic pieces with a twist of creative inspiration that was intriguing. The old masters are great, but much of the art here was classic And creative. The other great thing about the museum was that we could see all of the works witin 2 hours. That is probably longer than most people take to go through the museum. We took our time an dtook pictures of a lot of pieces and just admired them for a while. So, you can get your thirst for art in - and a deeper understanding of the culture and history of Argentina and Latin America, while not feeling like you may have missed something in another half of the museum, or taking up a whole day. The museum also has one of the best shops books that I have ever seen in a museum. It was a beautiful place to buy books - not just of the museums works, but of many different genres. It looks like a beutiful library with many book cases, with a gliding ladder, etc. It has a lvoely feel to the shop. ( The book shop is down on a lower level from the regular gift shop. Enter the regular gift shop, then head downstairs.) Take all the pictures you would like while there - just leave the flash off. The staff was not at all hovering or uptight hovering or uptight as at some museums in the U.S. Must be the sweet nature, and more relaxed attitude of the people in Buenos Aires in general. The staff in the various rooms was gracious and didn't mind taking a picture of my husband and I in front of a couple of pieces. Great place to visit. We highly recommend it.
One of the "must do's". Beautiful building and a small but diverse collection. Very good restaurant on the first floor. The special collection was very interesting.

Interesting installations!. Just missed the Japanese lady's exhibit with the dots, heard it was awesome. Great space with a large variety of art on several different floors. I loved the sound gauge they have in the front that tracks the sound of passing by traffic, or if you scream really loud!

Good survey of Latin art. A good selection of Latin American art over the past 100 years, including Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo as well as a Botero but many other artist perhaps less known outside of the region, all presented in a beautiful setting and convenient to Palermo. If you enjoy modern art you will enjoy MALBA

Noted works of art...... must see.. We were surprised that this intimate museum had such wonderful works of art. Check the open times and if you are there now in Feb 2014 make sure to see the photography show on the upper level with 2 terraces.

A great tour of Latin American Art. This is a great way to be introduced to Latin American art since 1900 up to the present. A very wide range of styles and movements are represented. There is a special installation right now by Liliana Porter call the Man with the Ax that you should see. You must see it to be believe it.
FAR OUT MODERN ART. Others complained not enough art--I felt it was just enough--& some really spectacular pieces including glass, metal & statues-busts. Spent 1.5 hours-never bored!
modern - beautiful. manageable size museum! great pieces, and very affordable. Can't miss it! I would totally recommend it!

Love this modern art museum in a beautiful new building. We thoroughly enjoyed a couple of hours in this beautiful new building in the center of Buenos Aires. The art is very interesting and well displayed. The restaurant serves excellent casual food for lunch at a reasonable price. A good way to spend a very hot summer afternoon in December.
Latin-American art in a modern setting. One of the museums in Buenos Aires you should visit. Even if you are not a fan of latin-american art, the building itself is well worth the visit.
Great museum. Really modern and with a wide range of exhibits from different artists. Great location as well and the building was amazing in itself

Well planned. For anyone who likes the contemporary, MALBA is a must-see. The building itself is bright, allowing natural light to accentuate some of the larger pieces. Each room has been designed well.

Interesting building, mediocre collection. The architectural style is very impressive, but the collection itself is of no deep interest, except for a few pieces. The museum store had more interesting items.
Excellant museum in an interesting building. The collection is amazing, vivid and imaginative as is the building. I just wish they could build on to it and have more!

Beautiful building, great cafe, mediocre art. Beware, the museum doesn't open until 12pm! So many people like us had arrived at 11am in the pouring rain. Luckily the cafe was open and we passed the time over a cup of coffee and later ate lunch there which was particularly good. The permanent exhibition was disappointing, with only a few really outstanding paintings. Well known artists such as Frieda Kahlo and Diego Rivera only had one work each, and amongst the other works there were only a few that showed any real depth. My overall impression was of an art school exhibition. But worth going to if you are interested in the modern expression of a countries culture.

somewhat disappointed. We found the contemporary style of the building of more interest than most of the exhibits it housed. With the exception of the self portrait of Frida Kahlo and a few other pieces the works were unimpressive. Fortunately the price of admission is reasonable.

A gem!. Not the largest modern Art Gallery, but it does have a very nice collection and it was wonderful to see the South American artists, some of which have not been shown in North America.The building itself is stunning, well worth a visit, especially if you can drop into the restaurant for a snack and a rest.

Modern Art Exhibited at its Best. I confess to liking art museums in general, though by no means am I an art fanatic. That said, I truly enjoyed this particular collection-exhibition more than most. In some sense, MALBA takes "less is more" to heart, by thoughtfully putting together an evocative display of Latin-American art - in all forms of visual media - that displays a richness of cultural expression without exhausting the visitor. The entire collection occupies two compact floors of exhibit halls with an open skylit three story space that itself is a work of art and architecture, with a few surprises.

Great Art Museum. We visited MALBA on the hottest day of the summer in BA. We walked to the museum from the Recoleta Cemetery are which took us about 40 minutes to get there. It is a good thing there is air conditioning. We were at the door when it first opened at noon. The initial ticket purchase process was slow, people deciding what type of ticket to purchase. The price was very reasonable. Seniors were free but we decided it was easier to pay for an adult ticket then to "demonstrate" that we were seniors. The building is very beautiful and airy. There are three levels of exhibits and you can take an escalator or a glass elevator up to each floor. Brochures about the exhibits are in English and Spanish. You are able to take photographs of the art. Just don't touch anything! Each exhibit has a staff member in the area to answer and questions. I enjoyed looking at art that I had seen only in magazines. MALBA also has a very nice gift shop.There is an excellent cafe / restaurant that is open lunch and dinner. You don't have to purchase a ticket to get into the restaurant. The food (and wine) was delicious - superb chef! Hours of operation: Thursday to Monday and Holidays 12 noon to 8pm. Wednesday 12 noon to 9pm. Closed on Tuesday.

A Gem. Architecturally stunning, permanent and temporary exhibitions very well presented. Easy to do in a couple of hours without "museum fatigue" setting in. A good introduction to many artists I'd never heard of and some of whom I'll look forward to learning more about. Lovely outdoor and indoor cafe where I first rested my tired feet and enjoyed some "bubbly" before touring the museum. Cost is low and even lower for seniors.

awesome art museum. I spent an afternoon at the Malba learning about modern art in Latin America. It was a great building and the collection was top quality. The parks nearby were also pleasant to explore.
Brilliant Art in a Brilliant Setting. Spend an afternoon learning about Contemporary Latin American art and then have a cocktail and dinner in the MALBA restaurant!
Great experience! . Very nice museum. The entrance is cheap, the collections are very interesting and the staff is helpful. There is a nice cafeteria on the first level and the prices there are high.
Loved the MALBA!!. Such a beautiful modern building and stunning inside. I enjoyed the architecture of the building as well aas the art work inside.

Very nice museum. A great opportunity to see some contemporary Latin American art. Its not a huge museum, but to does have a lot to offer. As an art nerd I really enjoyed the museum. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Buenos Aires.

Great museum!. This is a beautiful building as well as housing a great collection of Latin American art. If you like museums; this is one museum not to miss in Buenos Aires; there is also a nice little cafe with outdoor seating to get a glass of Argentinian wine.
nice museum. nice museum with contemporary art , I really enjoyed. nice location.there is a cafeteria/restaurant where you can sit outside

Nothing so amazing.... The place was ok, but we thought it was gonna be the best museum. The Fine Arts museum is much better and it is for free. It is not very recommendable unless u really luv latinamerican art.

Great collections. Very interesting collections of art. Well displayed for everyone to see and enjoy. I'm sure they could fit from pieces of work in there, but giving space to each piece made it easier to see and enjoy. Worth a visit if you like art.

Art at its best. The collection was much smaller than I expected and even though it is spread over three floors there are collections on the first floor only. Nevertheless excellent pieces of art and surprisingly not busy at all and visitors can take full advantage of it in a very relaxing atmosphere.

Was entertaining. The collections were entertaining enough and the building is great. I recommend booking a tour (i don't think the museum provides any so look online). But you should definitely plan on visiting.
Among the best. Among the best collections of Latin American Art in the world. Beautiful building, great collections and movie cycles.

Great architecture, highly interesting art. This is a very unique museum of contemporary latin american arts in a building of stunning architecture and world-class design. Take the time to visit, it is well worth it!

Small enough to be manageable.. Very interesting exhibits in a bright and interesting building. The collection is large enough to cover a lot of Latin American art trends but small enough to cover in an hour or two if you are really pressed for time. We especially enjoyed the special exhibit by Liliana Porter- "El hombre con el hacha y otras situaciones breves"

Must visit!. I'm not even such a great art fan, but I really enjoyed this museum! The building itself is beautiful and airy, and they carried the style over to the nice cafe.There are different exchibitions that change, and a permanent one. Definitely worth a couple of hours!Fun fact: If you have a Samsung device, you get two for one entry! (January 2014)

What a great, accessable, unstuffy art museum. Our family loved it!. Great break from the intense heat of Dec. 2013. Everyone loved it. Nice walk to museum from our hotel in Palermo Soho through the park beside the zoo.
Beautiful building. Exhibitions change. If you like modern art even a little bit, this is the place to visit. The building is beautiful. Nice restaurant.
Beautiful little art museum. This museum was very nice, a few beautiful paintings and sclptures, god way to spend 1-2 hrs on a hot afternoon in BA. Keep in mind, staff speaks very little English!

An interesting and fun Latin museum!!!. This museum is truly modern, bright and spacious. I go there every time I visit Buenos Aires. You´ll find a very interesting latin art collection, carefully curated. Most of the relevant Latin American Artists have paintings there.Enjoy it!!!
Nice Find In BA. A friend recommended this museum over some of the other options in BA. It proved to be a delightful way to spend several hours on a warm afternoon.

wonderful museum. I love this museum and I go there every time I have a chance.I find it has a very interesting latin art collection, very carefully curated, an assembly of the most representative works of many (if not every) relevant latin american artists.Works of Antonio Berni,Xul Solar, Di CAvalcanti, Torres GArcia, Petorutti, BAtlle Planas, Oiticica, Figari, KAhlo and many many others.The building itself is also very modern and interesting and they bring very nice shows such as the one of Yayoi Kusama througout the year.Definitely a place to visit for museum lovers.

Jewel box of a museum. Smallish collection of the best. If you enjoy contemporary art and some modern as well, take an hour and enjoy. Not overwhelming, giving you time to enjoy each piece. Definitely worth our visit!
One of the best museums in South America. The space itself is beautiful. The exhibits feature interesting and important work from South America's best artists. I highly recommend MALBA.

Exiting modern museum with great works displayed. I liked the airy building, the varity of modern colorful South american art from as long back as the 20ies, including installations. It just gave you a good feeling. And the gift shop is great. Hilde M

Decent Museum with Latin American Art. This is a smallish museum that merits a visit if you're in the general neighborhood. It offers a range of modern art from Latin America. I'm glad I went, but would have been disappointed if I'd crossed town for it alone.

MALBA cafe. I agree with favorable reviews of the museum & on suggestion from our local host, went for lunch in the museum cafe today. It is a light filled, white tablecloth restaurant that looks out to the park. The "hamburgesa" we ordered "jugosa" was delivered well done. My husband played it safe & ordered a chef's salad. We shared a 1/2 bottle of Cab/Malbec blend. Our tab was ARS $377 & they slapped on a ARS 50$ service charge. We could have eaten many places for far less. I recommend venturing away from the museum for lunch.
Simply wonderful.. The works by Lilliana porter are just simply wonderful. Lots of great pieces to look at. The second floor is so full you need to walk thru twice!!!!

The best museum in LA. A great museum with beautiful and different pieces from lots of countries and artists. The museum has 4 stores and you go around the pieces. You can look from a lot of angles. Recommended! Don't miss Tarcila do Amaral, Diego Rivera and Frida Kalo paintings.

Modern South American Artists. Beautiful building with a great collection of South American modern art. Some pieces were designed for the specific spaces in the building. Most descriptions in English and Spanish. Excellent bookstore attached to the gift shop. Nominal admission charge, but pretty limited hours during the day - check the opening and closing times.
Worth the visit !. It is worth making time to visit MALBA. There is some great Art on display for those who enjoy art and not. Would recommend going either way.

Great survey of 20th century Latin American/Eurocentric Art. The title says it all - all well known and not so well known 20th century eurocentric latino artists are present in a small collection that is well organized and curated. Don't come here looking for indigenous artists. The building itself is outstanding.
Beautiful museum. Deserve the visit it's located in a good neighbourhood in BSAS and it have a pretty important arts paint as Tarcilia de Amaral and. Frida Kaloo.

Lovely Museum. After visiting the San Telmo area last Sunday and needed a place to cool down we visited this beautiful very easy to navigate museum. The design and layout adds to the art. The gift shop was wonderful, too.

World-class collections in a gorgeous space.. I got to see the Liliana Porter installation (which is there until Feb. 24, 2014) and she instantly became one of my favorite artists.
They've got good holdings of Xul Solar, a nice Frida K, Diego, Siquieros.

Great space and art. We had a great visit here. MALBA is well designed and allows for a great introduction to Latin American artists. Unlike some other museums that feel endless and overfilled, MALBA is manageable and the exhibits are well curated. The art is displayed beautifully and the lighting is excellent. We enjoyed our visit here!

The exhibitions are better!. The museum itself is very small. There are some iconic pieces from proeminent Latin artists, such as Frida and Tarsila do Amaral. The exhibition tend to be a little more interesting than the rest. The gift shop has some really good stuff!

Art Art Art. Very surprised to see the quality and beauty of the Art shown. We enjoy 6 hours there . What was actually a brake for our family vacation .Later we came back to show some of the pieces we like best to our children ,

Best museum in BA - but small. Overall, I was not impressed with the museums in Buenos Aires, but the MALBA is the exception. The first floor has more traditional artwork - paintings and sculptures - whereas the second floor is more contemporary. I left feeling that the museum had a lot of good pieces, but was small and didn't have a coherent theme. The placards are in English and Spanish.The restaurant is excellent.
Visit Here when in BsAs. If its raining in BsAs ...put this museum on your list to visit....Easy to visit and worth a trip for any holiday

Worth The Trip. This contemporary art museum has, as the name indicates, paintings, prints, sculpture, and photography from Latin American artists. The entry fee is inexpensive and the collection is worth seeing. It's centrally located so the taxi fare is very reasonable as well. Hope this helps.

We love this little museum. We have visited this museum three times (in 2 trips to Buenos Aires). Each time there was a great temporary exhibit to view. The permanent collection is very interesting as well. The price is right (40 pesos) and seniors are half price (and not just Argentinian seniors). There is a cafe that serves very nice food and a patio for dining outdoors if the weather is good. Beware that the MALBA opens kind of late (noon, I think), so check the hours. Nearby are the Japanese garden and the Rose garden, if you find yourself in the area too early.Cameras are allowed inside, but you will have to check your backpacks.

For the love of Art. This one is an artist’s paradise. The various paintings with different themes, intelligent brush strokes was really interesting to look at. Though there are not a lot of paintings but whatever is being presented is worth a visit.

Great Art and beautiful area. The art museum has some really unique pieces. If you are lover of more contemporary art the museum is good choice. The area of BA it is in very nice and some great little shops and cafes.

Lovely, Small, Local. This museum is quite small and not like the European art museums I have seen before this. The artwork is limited, and I really only appreciated the art on the 2nd floor.However, the curation, the explanations of each room, and the set up is well done. They display what they have well and try to pull the viewer into the experience. It is not a passive experience in this museum - it challenges you in the question of "what is art?". I loved that part of the museum.We did, also, learn about Argentine artists that are a significant part of BA's identity. After visiting this museum, we saw their art and names in many other places. In that way, the viewing of this museum enhanced our experience in the rest of the city.I would most DEFINITELY recommend a visit to this place, but be aware it is a small collection, not one of the world's best classic European art museums.

Pointless. I might be a bit too rational, scientific, or realistic, but I found this museum a bit pointless. Went in there on a Sunday afternoon, with an open mind and a strong intention to visit, following all the positive reviews. However, after a short stroll, I started wondering what's the point of the artists and visitors walking around the premises. I felt like I was in a venue for mentally challenged people. I generally appreciate art in all it's forms, but this was a bit too far stretched for my taste.

Me gusta. A general ticket is 40 Pesos, but if you're a student make sure you bring your students card, you can get in for 25 Pesos. It's a cool muesum with changing exhibitions as well. Compared to european muesums it is not huge, but you still can find a lot to see. Make sure you bring a jacket in summer since it is airconditioned!

Not overly impressed. I was not overly impressed by this small museum. I know that it was a modern art museum but some of the works were really weird - like art made out of old moldy potatoes and a really large piece that looked like feces

Great artwork. Lovely modern building with a wide collection of modern & contemporary art from all over Latin America. Some of the artwork is stunning and very thought provoking. It also has a nice gift shop & restaurant. Well worth a visit & the 20 peso entry charge. Allow 2 hours for your visit.

Fantastic Museum of Latin American Art!. A wonderful, expansive collection of modern Latin American artwork - paintings, sculpture etc exhibited in a light-filled, modern building. MALBA offers an excellent introduction to LA art in an easy to navigate building that is not too large or overwhelming.Great for a 1-2 hour visit - or an afternoon.

Perfect Small museum. We visited on a Sunday after a walk around the park just down the street. The museum has a nice variety of artwork focusing on South American artists. This group is underrated and not publicized unfortunately in the northern hemisphere due to the overexposure of European artists. Anyway, the amount of art displayed is just enough and while I didn't care for some of it I appreciated the variety of different medians exhibited. The gift shop and cafe are worth a visit for some nice books and a coffee. Also, nice people watching at the cafe as a mix of residents and tourists visit. Well worth a visit.
Stunning. Very nice selection of southamerican art wonderfully displayed in a lightfilled architectual jewel of a building. Very interesting temporary exhibitions.

I recommend it. I came here twice, both times on Wednesdays where it is only 20 pesos for general admission, free with student ID card. It is a nice place to visit. I spent about 1-2 hours each time. The art is pretty good. The collection is not very extensive so you don't need to spend much time here.
Worth the visit. Comtemporary art from Latin America. Took about 1.5-2 hrs--to enjoy all the art work. Worth your time.

Great for Latin American Art. What a colorful and inventive collection! It is housed in an inviting building. The collection is contemporary and modern and very diverse. Instead of second rate work by top name artists you can view compelling work by Latin American artists that you see for the first time. This is the one museum in Buenos Aires that is a must see. It even has a nice museum shop.

Fantastic museum!. The building itself is lovely -- bright, open, spacious. In addition to wonderful special exhibits, the permanent collection is great. Alongisde their free informational brochures (which they have in both English and Spanish), the history of modern art is laid out and explained alongside classics from Latin American artists. There are works from the most famous artists (Rivera, Kahlo, Botero) as well as artists that are lesser known but equally incredible. Also it's free on Wednesday afternoons! The other days you can get discounts for youth, students, and seniors.

First Class Museum. MALBA is not only a first class museum but also a relaxing and enjoyable place to spend a couple of hours. From the airy atrium hall to the bright galleries, everything was delightful. Don't miss the excellent art and beautiful museum.I wish I had read the guidebook to know that they had a nice dining area before we went.
Great little museum. Wonderful collection of Latin American art from Diego Riviera, Frida Kahlo to more contemporary artists like Guillermo Kuitka. A steal at A$40!

Wonderful collection of art. The museum had a nice collection of modern art and is easy to navigate over a period of several hours. Some of the art is whimsical and begs for interaction. There is a nice coffee shop for relaxation, the gift shop/bibliotheca offers a good selection of items, and the bagnos are clean
Excellent LA museum. Place is great, take time and be the authentic "porteño" and take a coffee at the Museum bar. There are always good artistics features to see. Anytime is good.

MALBA. EXCELLENT, THE PROUD OF THE CITI AND COUNTRY!!!!
Good information about the paintins and sculptures.
Lovelig and modern builiding.
I love it!!!!!!!!

Excellent way to spend a few hours.. Tired of seeing the usual suspects in art (European and US based artists), it was refreshing to view Latin American works of modern art. Well worth a visit and the accompanying cafe is a great stop to sip, sup and people watch.

Terrific museum - don't miss. Best museum for South American art and beautiful modern building designed to showcase art. Nice size for 1-2 hours to see/learn about LATAM art. Nice array of artists and styles.

Perfect museum. Everything about MALBA is perfect. The building is a gem, the expositions were just the right size, beautifully presented. We sat under the jacaranda trees in full bloom for good lunch.

Refreshing art in a great environment. Very refreshing to see this collection of different artists to the European diet. Great relaxed gallery too and they dont mind you taking photos.
Get along and see for yourself. Will post some pics if it lets me

a must. Ok, so it was a rainy day, i admit, but this would have been on my must do list anyway, i swear.The museum is in a nice area and is a good collection of mostly modern art and the space itself embraces this type of art and sets the mood beautifully. As I am an Eastern European it is quite difficult to see a Diego Rivera or a Frida Kahlo so, for me, it was amazing.They also have a cafe that i have not tried and the gift shop has cool stuff, yet overpriced.

Wonderful collection. Small mangeable museo showcasing Latin, mostly aregentian artists from the 20th century onwards, with some small temporary exhibits as well. Really enjoyable visit. Has films shown as well for admission charges. Enjoyable

Very Enjoyable. I'm not much of an art lover, but I like to visit museums once in a while and this was a great one to visit. All the exhibitions were open, and the entrance fee is cheaper on Wednesdays (and free, if you are a student with a valid student pass!). The exhibits are very palatable! I was lucky to be there when Liliana Porter's exhibit was there. It was so interesting and my favourite in the entire museum. If you don't speak or read Spanish well, don't worry because the museum has everything in English as well. Definitely recommend for everyone to pop by this museum for a lovely afternoon.

A must for contemporary Argentinian art lovers. The Malba has a rich collection af Argentinian modern art. It also organizes great temporary exhibitions and its architecture in itself worth a visit. You can also enjoy a beautiful café which provides quite good salads.
Awesome contemporary art. A definite must-see if you like modern art. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed MALBA and all it had to offer. A beautiful museum with very unique, creative pieces!

If you want contemporary Latin American art - beautiful. this is a very pleasant museum, with beautiful spaces and a nice collection of contemporary works. It's often too crowded. We once saw a very welldone children's show in the auditorium there - which would get 5 stars on it's own, but they only show kids theater during school vacations.

Nice 2 hour museum. It's nice to fund high quality museums where you don't have to plan to spend your entire vacation to see all the collection. Malba collection can be seen in a couple hours. The collection is eclectic and worth the time to see.

great art in a fabulous building. The design of the building makes the museum easy to conquer in that you don't have to worry that you've missed a whole room or wing. It is well laid out. The size of the museum is perfect- not so many that you need hours and hours to see everything. Representation of the great South American artists I was familiar with, such as Torres Garcia, Frida Kahlo, Sorollo, Xul Solar. Only sad thing was that the Frida Kahlo was behind glass.

Excellent. I had just two hours to visit this museum and I enjoyed every single minute. I enjoyed permanent and temporary exhibition, having the chance to know latin america artists taht are not yet popular in Europe where I live.Building is amazing, very well located and served with public transport, cafeteria and bar are nice and there is a nice bookshop too.I will be back again there as soon as possible

Great gallery, but very little open.. What we saw was fantastic, but there was only one gallery open on the day we went, and we still had to pay full price. Still totally recommend MALBA, but check whether the top and bottom galleries are open before you go.

MALBA Magic. We really enjoyed the MALBA. Of all the Buenos Aires museums it feels the most "familiar" ie. big city US museum :). It's a modern building in a beautiful neighborhood. The cafe has a lovely outdoor area where we thoroughly enjoyed some cafe con leche. The exhibits were very well done, with a great variety and some of my all time favorites - Botero, Kahlo, and exposed me to a lot of new artists that I thoroughly enjoyed. It's totally worth the small entrance fee.
Worth doing. Somehow reminded me of the Saatchi gallery in London. Nice mix. Works well in its well appointed location

Superb Collection!!. The MALBA has been one of the most surprising places during our stay in Buenos Aires. The museum is beautifully designed, well laid out, and filled with a fantastic collection of modern latin art. The special visiting exhibit wasnt too much to our liking, but we nonetheless were impressed by the professionalism throughout the museum. A must visit while in Buenos Aires

Small, but VERY good!. very small exhibits and everything is still under construction, more installation. The permanent collection has a Frida Kalo, self portairt worthy seeing...beautiful cosmopoltian space.

fresh modern art. this is like a fresh air in a very traditional town. Good art collection and very nice temporary exhibitions. Focused on latin american art, including the icconic Abapuru from brazilian tarsila do amaral.

It's a place.. Fine art? Yes, but in a space designed to be absent, as if it didn't existed.
The area where it's placed is way far, and for a traveler like me it was hard to find.

A Gem of a Building and Collection. Tempted by the prospect of Frida Kahlo's work I visited MALBA. The gallery doesn't open until noon (or at least it didn't on the day I went) and I suspect a few people had arrived long before that expecting it to be open. If you do arrive early treat yourself to a coffee in the smart restaurant that is part of the building and can be accessed separately.The modern building is interesting in its own right. There are three levels. Sadly two were closed so I spent less time than I expected but was not disappointed with the permanent collection. Only one Kahlo work but other very interesting works.Well worth a visit.

Nice collection. MALBA is definitely worth a trip - the museum itself is nicely designed and I enjoyed the art (as a non-expert). The upstairs exhibition area was closed, so the experience was shorter than I expected. But I'd probably go back.

Kosoma was spectacular. The artist Kosoma's exhibit was wonderfully enchanting. What we really liked was the overall presentation of the exhibit from the polka dotted trees in front to the interactive art piece with dots handed out with your admission.

Check spacial exhibitions. The area where the museum is is very nice. there is a shopping center close by "Paseo Alcorta". The museum has a good collections but usually the special exhibitons are even more important.The museum has a cafe where you can also have lunch, worth a visit.
Great place to visit and explore art!. Recently went to Yayoi Kusama's exhibit here and it was great! A bit crowded but nevertheless very worth seeing. The surrounding area is beautiful too!

Excellent. For art lovers it's a must go. The museum has an excellent collection. Temporary exhibits are usually very interesting. The building is also an art piece in itself. The rooms are spacious and very welcoming. I spent wonderful afternoons there. I highly recommend.
